intro: Nigritella cenisia, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of darker, tubular flowers, giving it its common name. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in open woodlands and prairies. Nigritella cenisia is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
